keyTakeAways: Military jackets, particularly the Hussar pelisse, are experiencing a fashion resurgence, inspired by historical and cultural references.
Celebrities such as Jodie Turner-Smith, Zendaya, and Jenna Ortega have prominently featured military-style outerwear in recent fashion events.
The style has roots in the 1960s, notably associated with Jimi Hendrix, who wore Hussar coats in a subversive, bohemian manner.
The Beatles' use of military coats on the 'Sargent Peppers' album cover was a statement of anti-establishment and anti-war sentiment.
Luxury fashion brands like Saint Laurent, Balmain, Gucci, and Marc Jacobs have historically adopted and reimagined the Hussar coat in creative, fashion-forward ways.
The trend has evolved into a modern fashion staple, seen in recent collections from Dior, McQueen, Vaquera, and Ann Demeulemeester.
Global search volume for 'Hussar jacket' increased by 300% in October 2025 compared to the previous month, indicating strong public interest.
The resurgence reflects a broader cultural interest in historical garments and rebellious fashion statements.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The fashion world is experiencing a revival of the Hussar pelisse, a military-style jacket with historical roots, as seen in recent appearances by celebrities like Jodie Turner-Smith, Zendaya, and Jenna Ortega. The trend traces back to the 1960s, when Jimi Hendrix and The Beatles used the garment as a symbol of rebellion and anti-establishment sentiment, and was popularized by musicians like Kate Moss and The Libertines. Modern luxury brands such as Saint Laurent, Gucci, and Dior have reinterpreted the style in creative, fashion-forward ways. A surge in global searches for 'Hussar jacket'—a 300% increase in October 2025—demonstrates growing public interest, signaling its status as a prominent wardrobe staple in contemporary fashion.
